features: MAXIMUM CONTROL: Easily customize lighting and cooling modes via NZXT CAM, with access to six RGB lighting channels. Configure lights and fans from any manufacturer.
FINISHING TOUCH: A white or black metal cover conceals the inner workings, blending seamlessly with your case. The heat fins have been expanded to cool the PCIe Gen 5 enabled NVMe drive slot.
READY TO ROCK: Integrated Wi-Fi 6E, rear I/O shield, and clever port placement makes the build process easy—plenty of room on board for upgrades down the line.
STUNNING CRAFTSMANSHIP: Build your dream system with a full metal cover that blends aesthetically with black or white cases for a seamless backdrop for your components
CPU and SOCKET: Supports AMD Ryzen 7000 Series Processors

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 80 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: N7 B650E Leverage the full value of your AMD Ryzen 7000 series CPU with the AMD B650 chipset. The N7 B650E features upgraded compatibility as well as N7 favorites, such as digital RGB and fan control, Wi-Fi 6e, and more. 16+2+1 Power phase design with 90A Smart Power Stage Seamless cover with integrated heat spreader Digital RGB lighting control through CAM Digital fan control for convenient fan profiles with seven independent fan channels

Maximum Control Easily customize lighting and cooling modes via NZXT CAM, with access to six RGB lighting channels. Configure lights and fans from any manufacturer. Finishing Touch A white or black metal cover conceals the inner workings, blending seamlessly with your case. The heat fins have been expanded to cool the PCIe Gen 5 enabled NVMe drive slot. Quick Setup Integrated Wi-Fi 6E, rear I/O shield, and clever port placement makes the build process easy—plenty of room on board for upgrades down the line.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very clean looking, easy bios control, and overall pretty nice, did have some trouble tho.
reviews.reviewText: Had a bit of trouble with the WiFi, had to install drivers on it, even though in the bios it was enabled, so just update your bios and install the drivers from NZXT. If you go to this board’s product page from NZXT official page and scroll all the way down, you should fine BIOS drivers, WiFi drivers, Bluetooth drivers, etc. Clean board, great bios control, and very little problems.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well-made aesthetically pleasing AM5 motherboard
reviews.reviewText: I was going for a white aesthetic with my build and this mobo was perfect. I had no issues with installation or drivers. Everything just worked.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A+ know what you're getting first
reviews.reviewText: I know there were some reviews that tried to downplay this board and state that it was over price but there is some aspects that people need to really consider. First this is a strong motherboard option for the simple fact that you have upwards of a u s b options. Most boards that are in the 650V range come with 6 to 7. There is also three additional NVME ports aside from the single 5.0x. The board doesn't need "heatsinks" because the frame of the design is the cooling mechanism, the covers are also magnetic making removal very easy and protects the panels. Supports wifi and BT. It's prices exactly the same as is competition 650E boards from the OEM Taichi. It supports expo and pcie 5.0. Locking USB C port also. Fired up my 32 FURY sticks @ 6000, no problem, no heat issues with 7 series CPU either. I'm really unsure how anybody can snub this board below 4 stars. Are their cheaper options? Yes, what about from AsRock, yes.... because most other 650's in range aren't extreme, have less I/O options like USB ports and riddles with issues. I've yet to see a single complaint eliminate this board from being purchased. Hence why I own it. I don't think the often compared B650A -F or E -F from Asus blows it out the water...because you get less features, and the other boards aren't nearly as good looking. Your paying for a name and not features. Lastly, did I mention the leg-up on NZXT's CAM software compatibility since I own a Kraken?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Motherboard! No issues at all.
reviews.reviewText: I converted from a MSI MPG B650I Edge WiFi Gaming Motherboard to this one and couldn't be happier. Connectivity is fantastic, it stays cool, runs great, no crashes or issues with a 3090 GPU and 128GB ram. It has a super clean look; I would highly recommend this board!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Received a faulty motherboard
reviews.reviewText: The motherboard I received was faulty. Once installed, every error light was lighting up. I purchased a different brand of motherboard, which worked completely fine. I am sure that the motherboard was compatible with the rest of my PC and installed correctly. Although, it was very nice in appearance as I have an all white build, there is an issue with the motherboard and I unfortunately am sending this back to get a refund. I wouldn't purchase this brand again and will stick with ROG in the future as everything I have purchased from them is reliable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My girlfriend wanted a PC build with a white color theme. This board is sleek and looks great in her case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great motherboard for the price.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install. I picked this up to match my white PC build. I have a Ryzen 7800X3D and RX 7900 XTX hooked up as well as three Samsung 2TB nvme. Drives setup and configuration was simple as well as using the EXPO for overlocking the memory.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I flashed bios before downloading windows and everything works! Paired with a Ryzan 7800x3d, gigabyte rtx vision 3080ti, and 64 gig of Corsair vengeance
Estéticamente muy buena… todo funciona bien, no me gusta que el RGB solo funciona a full con productos de la misma marca de la mobo.
